Reception for participants in European seminar
    Pyongyang, June 24 (KCNA) --  The preparatory committee for the European regional seminar on the Juche idea and socialism  and the delegation of the Korean Social Scientists Society co-hosted a reception at the DPRK embassy in Moscow on June 18 in honor of its participants.      Speakers at the reception said that the seminar would be a new turning-point in widely disseminating the Juche idea, the philosophical ideology centred on man, in the European region.   Only when guided by the Juche idea, will socialism certainly revive and triumph, they added.    They renewed their determination to dynamically struggle along the road of global independence indicated by General Secretary  Kim Jong Il.

Pilgrimage for national unity and reunification begins
    Pyongyang, June 24 (KCNA) -- Over 100 students of Korea theological seminary of Pusan Tuesday began a cross-country pilgrimage for national unity and reunification in Kwangju, according to a Seoul-based radio report.
  They visited the graveyard of May 18 martyrs of Kwangju to cherish their memory that day.  With this as the start, they plan to march up to Panmunjom. 
They are scheduled to arrive in Panmunjom on July 6 on foot via Jonju, Chonan and Seoul, and so on.

Indonesian minister gives reception
   Pyongyang, June 24 (KCNA) -- Feisal Tanjung, Coordinating Minister for Policy and Security of Indonesia, on Wednesday gave a reception in connection with the conclusion of his Korean visit.
   Invited to the reception were vice marshal of the KPA Kim Il Chol, Minister of the People's Armed Forces, KPA general Jong Chang Ryol, vice-Minister of Foreign Affairs Pak Tong Chun and officials concerned.
   Present there were the Coordinating Minister for Policy and Security and his party,  Indonesian ambassador to the DPRK Buchari Effendi and embassy officials.
   Speeches were made at the reception.

Greetings to Slovenia leaders
    Pyongyang, June 24 (KCNA) -- President Kim Yong Nam of the presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea today sent a congratulatory message to President Milan Kucan of the Republic of Slovenia on its Independence Day.   The message wished the Slovenian President and people successes in their work for the progress and prosperity of the country.Meanwhile, congratulatory messages were also sent by premier Hong Song Nam of the cabinet to Slovenian Prime Minister Janez Drnovsek and by Foreign Minister Paek Nam Sun to Slovenian Foreign Minister Boris Frlec respectively on this anniversary.
